Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder-section of a brown pottery ribbed vessel with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is partially greyish in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip, faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink and a number of incised symbols.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394438) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394438)
